Candidate :  Mohammad El -Mootasse  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   UAE – Abu Dhabi  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering – Khalifa University  2014  
• Awarded for being top -achiev ing Chemical Engineering student of my graduating batch  
•  
Master of Science in Chemical Engineering – Khalifa University  2017  
• Journal Publication: Synthesis and Characterization of Porous Carbon from Petroleum Pitch 
Using  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2015 to present ADNOC Refining, Abu Dhabi, UAE  
 
July 2021 – Present  
Position: Senior Process Engineer  
• Working in and covering all aspects of hydrogen manufacturing, Sulfur Recovery (Claus 
Process), sour water treatment, amine regeneration, utilities and wastewater treatment.  
 
March  2015 – July 2021  
Position: Process Engineer  
• Carried out process simulation ASPEN HYSYS and Petrosim used for optimizing ongoing 
operations and carrying out calculations for MOCs and predicting crude properties of different 
crude ass ay mixtures.  
• Utilized PI software, sample lab results and Excel to continuously monitor, troubleshoot and 
optimize field operations by comparing current and design parameters.  
• Monitored and optimized chemical and catalyst stock and lifecycle. This incl udes reactor bed 
profiles monitoring and coordinating with procurement team to review technical bids by 
Vendors.  
• Participated in new major refinery projects/expansions activities including FEED, EPC, MC 
Walkthroughs, PSSRs and commissioning ensuring the project execution was up to design 
standards.  
• Participated in many HAZOP, LOPA, MOC technical reviews and SIL reviews ensuring that all 
process designs, and modifications are safe during implementation.  
• Coordinated catalyst bed replacement activities w ith licensor and contractor ensuring correct 
loading configuration was achieved for optimum operating conditions. This includes sock and 
dense loading.  
 • Ensured environmental regulations are met for refinery wastewater treatment plant by 
maintaining healt h of bacteria in the system, dosing of chemicals and safe removal of produced 
sludge and waste material.  
• Continuous monitoring, troubleshooting and optimization of sulphur recovery (Clause process), 
hydrogen manufacturing (SMR), amine regeneration, sour water treatment and spent caustic 
treatment.  
• Coordinated with integrity team and chemical vendors for maintaining and optimizing health of 
the utility systems such as steam, steam condensate, boiler feed water, fresh cooling water and 
desalinated water.  
• Participated in plant Turnaround, working many hours overtime, to conduct vessel, tray and 
exchanger inspection, catalyst loading and ensuring all necessary modifications were 
implemented on time.  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
A Senior process engineer with 7+ years’ experience in one of the largest refineries in the world. I have 
a background in Hydrogen manufacturing, Sulfur Recovery (Claus Process), Sour water, amine 
treatment, utilities and wastewater treatment. He has  consistently monitored, troubleshooted and 
optimized systems to achieve the best results. In his career, he has  implemented a refinery information 
system, reduced operating costs, and worked on the FEED, EPC, and commissioning of 3 refinery 
expansion projec ts. He is  very hard -working with recognised career -based achievements, and has 
strong personal skills proving my ability to fulfil my teams and organizations objectives . 
 
Key achievements:  
• System Development – Coordinated with Honeywell for the development of Refinery 
Information System by providing full inputs of critical assets monitoring and mass/energy 
balances for utility systems.  
• Plant life extension – Closely monitoring and optimizing catalyst performance allowing for 
extension of catalyst life reducing cost of p rocuring new catalyst and production downtime.  
• Optimized Performance – Hydrogen network optimization by studying economics of different 
hydrogen producers in the network and applying optimization tools for selecting the ideal load 
sharing configuration.  
• Chemical Change – Reduced maintenance requirement for Sour wat

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
